NOTE TO DATA SOURCE DEVELOPERS:

This template is based upon the AnnotationDataSource interface, there are however three other interfaces available that may be more appropriate for your needs, described here:

Writing a MyDas Data Source - Selecting the Best Inteface

Method Detail

init

public void init(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext,
                 Map<String,String> globalParameters,
                 uk.ac.ebi.mydas.controller.DataSourceConfiguration dataSourceConfig)
          throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
This method is called by the MydasServlet class at Servlet initialisation.

The AnnotationDataSource is passed the servletContext, a handle to globalParameters in the form of a Map <String, String> and a DataSourceConfiguration object.

The latter two parameters contain all of the pertinent information in the ServerConfig.xml file relating to the server as a whole and specifically to this data source. This mechanism allows the datasource author to set up required configuration in one place, including AnnotationDataSource specific configuration.

It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.

Specified by:
init in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Parameters:
servletContext - being the ServletContext of the servlet container that the Mydas servlet is running in.
globalParameters - being a Map <String, String> of keys and values as defined in the ServerConfig.xml file.
dataSourceConfig - containing the pertinent information frmo the ServerConfig.xml file for this datasource, including (optionally) a Map of datasource specific configuration.
Throws:
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.

getFeatures

public uk.ac.ebi.mydas.model.DasAnnotatedSegment getFeatures(String segmentReference)
                                                      throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.BadReferenceObjectException,
                                                             uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
This method returns a List of DasAnnotatedSegment objects, describing the annotated segment and the features of the segmentId passed in as argument.

Specified by:
getFeatures in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Parameters:
segmentReference - being the reference of the segment requested in the DAS request (not including start and stop coordinates)

If your datasource implements only this interface, the MydasServlet will handle restricting the features returned to the start / stop coordinates in the request and you will only need to implement this method to return Features. If on the other hand, your data source includes massive segments, you may wish to implement the RangeHandlingAnnotationDataSource interface. It will then be the responsibility of your AnnotationDataSource plugin to restrict the features returned for the requested range.

Returns:
A DasAnnotatedSegment object. This describes the segment that is annotated, limited to the information required for the /DASGFF/GFF/SEGMENT element. References a Collection of DasFeature objects. Note that this is a basic Collection - this gives you complete control over the details of the Collection type - so you can create your own comparators etc.
Throws:
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.BadReferenceObjectException - in the event that your server does not include information about this segment.
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.

getTypes

public Collection<uk.ac.ebi.mydas.model.DasType> getTypes()
                                                   throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
This method is used to implement the DAS types command. (See DAS 1.53 Specification : types command. This method should return a Collection containing all the types described by the data source (one DasType object for each type ID).

For some data sources it may be desirable to populate this Collection from a configuration file or to

Specified by:
getTypes in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Returns:
a Collection of DasType objects - one for each type id described by the data source.
Throws:
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.

getFeatures

public Collection<uk.ac.ebi.mydas.model.DasAnnotatedSegment> getFeatures(Collection<String> featureIdCollection,
                                                                         Collection<String> groupIdCollection)
                                                                  throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.UnimplementedFeatureException,
                                                                         uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
For some Datasources, especially ones with many entry points, this method may be hard or impossible to implement. If this is the case, you should just throw an UnimplementedFeatureException as your implementation of this method, so that a suitable error HTTP header (X-DAS-Status: 501 Unimplemented feature) is returned to the DAS client as described in the DAS 1.53 protocol.

This method is used by the features command when no segments are included, but feature_id and / or group_id filters have been included, to meet the following specification:

"feature_id (zero or more; new in 1.5)
Instead of, or in addition to, segment arguments, you may provide one or more feature_id arguments, whose values are the identifiers of particular features. If the server supports this operation, it will translate the feature ID into the segment(s) that strictly enclose them and return the result in the features response. It is possible for the server to return multiple segments if the requested feature is present in multiple locations. group_id (zero or more; new in 1.5)
The group_id argument, is similar to feature_id, but retrieves segments that contain the indicated feature group." (Direct quote from the DAS 1.53 specification, available from http://biodas.org/documents/spec.html#features.)

Note that if segments are included in the request, this method is not used, so feature_id and group_id filters accompanying a list of segments will work correctly, even if your implementation of this method throws an UnimplementedFeatureException.

Specified by:
getFeatures in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Parameters:
featureIdCollection - a Collection<String> of feature_id values included in the features command / request. May be a java.util.Collections.EMPTY_LIST but will not be null.
groupIdCollection - a Collection<String> of group_id values included in the features command / request. May be a java.util.Collections.EMPTY_LIST but will not be null.
Returns:
A Collection of DasAnnotatedSegment objects. These describe the segments that is annotated, limited to the information required for the /DASGFF/GFF/SEGMENT element. Each References a Collection of DasFeature objects. Note that this is a basic Collection - this gives you complete control over the details of the Collection type - so you can create your own comparators etc.
Throws:
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.UnimplementedFeatureException - Throw this if you cannot provide a working implementation of this method.

getTotalCountForType

public Integer getTotalCountForType(uk.ac.ebi.mydas.model.DasType type)
                             throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
This method allows the DAS server to report a total count for a particular type for all annotations across the entire data source. If it is not possible to retrieve this value from your dsn, you should return null.

Specified by:
getTotalCountForType in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Parameters:
type - containing the information needed to retrieve the type count (type id and optionally the method id and category id. Note that the last two may be null, which needs to be taken into account by the implementation.)
Returns:
The total count across the entire data source (not just for one segment) for the specified type. If it is not possible to determine this count, this method should return null.
Throws:
uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.

registerCacheManager

public void registerCacheManager(uk.ac.ebi.mydas.controller.CacheManager cacheManager)
The mydas DAS server implements caching within the server. This method passes your datasource a reference to a CacheManager object. To implement this method, you should simply retain a reference to this object. In your code you can then make use of this object to manipulate caching in the mydas servlet.

At present the CacheManager class provides you with a single method public void emptyCache() that you can call if (for example) the underlying data source has changed.

Specified by:
registerCacheManager in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
Parameters:
cacheManager - a reference to a CacheManager object that the data source can use to empty the cache for this data source.

getLinkURL

public URL getLinkURL(String field,
                      String id)
               throws uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.UnimplementedFeatureException,
                      uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException
This method returns a URL, based upon a request built as part of the DAS 'link' command. The nature of this URL is entirely up to the data source implementor.

The mydas servlet will redirect to the URL provided. This command is intended for use in an internet browser, so the URL returned should be a valid internet address. The page can return content of any MIME type and is intended to be 'human readable' rather than material for consumption by a DAS client.

The link command takes two mandatory arguments:

  • a 'field' parameter which is limited to one of five valid values. This method is guaranteed to be called with the 'field' parameter set to one of these values (any other request will be handled as an error by the mydas DAS server servlet.) The 'field' parameter will be one of the five static String constants that are members of the AnnotationDataSource interface.
  • an 'id' field. Again, this will be validated by the mydas servlet to ensure that it is a non-null, non-zero length String.
      • See DAS 1.53 Specification: Linking to a Feature for details.

      If your data source does not implement this method, an UnimplementedFeatureException should be thrown.

      Specified by:
      getLinkURL in interface uk.ac.ebi.mydas.datasource.AnnotationDataSource
      Parameters:
      field - one of 'feature', 'type', 'method', 'category' or 'target' as documented in the DAS 1.53 specification
      id - being the ID of the indicated annotation field
      Returns:
      a valid URL.
      Throws:
      uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.UnimplementedFeatureException - in the event that the DAS data source does not implement the link command
      uk.ac.ebi.mydas.exceptions.DataSourceException - should be thrown if there is any fatal problem with loading this data source. It is highly desirable for the implementation to test itself in this init method and throw a DataSourceException if it fails, e.g. to attempt to get a Connection to a database and read a record.
